content:
Yes, finding good local restaurants is a great way to experience the authentic cuisine and culture of Passau and Cesky Krumlov. Here are some tips for finding great places to eat:

1. Ask locals - Locals are the best source of information when it comes to finding good restaurants. Don't be afraid to ask your hotel staff, tour guides, or even the locals you meet on the street for recommendations. 2. Check online reviews - You can check popular online review websites like TripAdvisor or Yelp to see recommendations from fellow travelers. Be sure to read a mix of positive and negative reviews to get an accurate sense of the restaurant's strengths and weaknesses. 3. Look for local specialties - Both Passau and Cesky Krumlov have unique regional dishes that you should try. In Passau, be sure to sample the local Bavarian cuisine, such as schnitzel or Weisswurst, while in Cesky Krumlov, try the traditional Bohemian dishes such as roast pork, dumplings or goulash. 4. Explore side streets - Sometimes the best restaurants are hidden away on the smaller streets, a few blocks away from the main tourist areas. Take a stroll around the town and look out for local restaurants that have menus in the local language. 5. Reserve a table in advance - Many popular restaurants in both towns can get busy, especially during peak season. To avoid disappointment, it's always best to reserve a table in advance. With these tips, you should be able to find some great local restaurants to enjoy during your stay in Passau and Cesky Krumlov!
